com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.api

Class JobEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.api.JobEnvironment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class JobEnvironment
extends java.lang.Thread

    This class is used to run and manage individual LocalJobs. Each LocalJob is run by it its own unique JobEnvironment. The JobEnvironment is used to load the LocalJob subclass, prepare its running environment, and clean up after the LocalJob when it has finished running.

    This class also provides an essential interface between the node and individual jobs, allowing jobs to access the public API.

    Author:
    Carter Waxman

    • Field Detail

      • node

        private LocalNode node

        The running LocalNode instance.

      • job

        private LocalJob job

        The LocalJob this JobEnvironment runs.

      • listener

        private final JobEnvironment.JobStateListener listener

        A listener that will respond to updates to the state of the LocalJob.

      • watchdog

        private final Watchdog watchdog

        The Watchdog for the current node. Used to create and destroy beacons when running the LocalJob.

      • cleanup

        private final boolean cleanup

        Whether the class and associated files should automatically be cleaned after termination. This will only be true for remote jobs.

      • type

        private final java.lang.Class<? extends LocalJob> type

        This is the dynamically loaded subclass. An instance of this will be created when this JobEnvironment is started.

      • parent

        private final RemoteJob parent

        The parent / creator of this JobEnvironment's LocalJob. It will be null for locally created jobs.

      • classPath

        private final java.io.File classPath

        The folder under which the LocalJob may create files.

      • initData

        private final java.io.File initData

        The initialization parameters for the LocalJob (defined by the LocalJob).

    • Constructor Detail

      • JobEnvironment

        public JobEnvironment(LocalNode node,
              java.lang.String className,
              java.io.File classPath,
              RemoteNode parent,
              java.lang.String remoteTid,
              java.io.File initData,
              Watchdog watchdog,
              boolean cleanup,
              JobEnvironment.JobStateListener listener)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

        Instantiates a ProccessorJobWrapper with the parameters needed to start a new LocalJob.

        Parameters:
        node - The running LocalNode instance.
        className - The name of the LocalJob subclass to load.
        classPath - The path to the directory that contains the LocalJob subclass class file.
        source - The node that sent the LocalJob to this node, or null if the job is to be created locally.
        remoteTid - The thread id of the LocalJob that sent the LocalJob to load to this node.
        initData - The initialization parameters for the LocalJob.
        watchdog - The Watchdog for this node.
        cleanup - Whether the files created should be deleted after the job has completed
        listener - A ProcessorJobStateListener to handle events related to startup.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
